IDBCursorUpdate.summary:
The update() method of the
interface returns an object, and, in a separate thread,
updates the value at the current position of the cursor in the object store. If the
cursor points to a record that has just been deleted, a new record is created.

remarks.para:
Be aware that you can't call update() (or
) on cursors obtained from
. For such needs, you have to use
instead.

IDBCursorUpdate.returns: An object on which subsequent events related to this operation are fired.If the operation is successful, the value of the request's property is the key for the updated record.
